content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 7 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 4. f of x is 3.654. Column 2. x is 4.5. f of x is 3.600. Column 3. x is 5. f of x is 3.455. Column 4. x is 5.5. f of x is 3.244. Column 5. x is 6. f of x is 1. Column 6. x is 6.5. f of x is 0.75. Column 7. x is 7. f of x is 0.5. "><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em " equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>3.654</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.600</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.455</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.244</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.75</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The graph of the function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a table of selected values of <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are shown above. The graph of <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a horizontal tangent line at <math alttext="x equals 4"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, is concave down for <math alttext="0 less than x, less than 6"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and is linear for <math alttext="x greater than or equal to 6"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)      Approximate the value of <math alttext="f prime of 5.5"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> using data from the table. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 7 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 4. f of x is 3.654. Column 2. x is 4.5. f of x is 3.600. Column 3. x is 5. f of x is 3.455. Column 4. x is 5.5. f of x is 3.244. Column 5. x is 6. f of x is 1. Column 6. x is 6.5. f of x is 0.75. Column 7. x is 7. f of x is 0.5. "><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em " equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>3.654</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.600</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.455</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.244</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.75</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The graph of the function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a table of selected values of <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are shown above. The graph of <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a horizontal tangent line at <math alttext="x equals 4"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, is concave down for <math alttext="0 less than x, less than 6"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and is linear for <math alttext="x greater than or equal to 6"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)      Approximate the value of <math alttext="f prime of 5.5"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> using data from the table. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(b)      Is there a value of <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="0 less than x, less than 6"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="the limit as h approaches 0, of, the fraction with numerator f of, open parenthesis, x plus h, close parenthesis, minus, f of x, and denominator h, end fraction, equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Give a reason for your answer.

(c)      For each of the following limits, find the value or explain why it does not exist.

(i) <math alttext="the limit as h approaches 0 from the right, of, the fraction with numerator f of, open parenthesis, 6 plus h, close parenthesis, minus, f of 6, and denominator h, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>(ii) <math alttext="the limit as h approaches 0 from the left, of, the fraction with numerator f of, open parenthesis, 6 plus h, close parenthesis, minus, f of 6, and denominator h, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>(iii) <math alttext="the limit as h approaches 0, of, the fraction with numerator f of, open parenthesis, 6 plus h, close parenthesis, minus, f of 6, and denominator h, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
